turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Roseomonas hibiscisoli.
turn.1: What is the difference between Roseomonas hibiscisoli and other gram-negative bacteria?
turn.2: Roseomonas hibiscisoli Roseomonas hibiscisoli is a species of Gram negative, strictly aerobic, coccobacilli-shaped, pink-colored bacteria.
turn.4: It was first isolated from the rhizosphere of a Hibiscus syriacus plant, and the new species was proposed in 2017.
turn.5: Is that where it gets its name?
turn.6: The species name derives from the "Hibiscus" plant from which it was first isolated.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: "Roseomonas rhizosphaerae" was also previously isolated from the rhizosphere of a plant.
